verses.verse: There <S%H3426>is<s%> an <S%H7451>evil<s%> which I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun,<s%> and it is <S%H7227>heavy<s%> on <S%H120>men:<s%>

a <S%H376>man<s%> to whom <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>gives<s%> <S%H6239>riches,<s%> <S%H6239>wealth,<s%> and <S%H3519>honor,<s%> so that he <S%H2638>lacks<s%> nothing for his <S%H5315>soul<s%> of all that he <S%H183>desires,<s%> yet <S%H430>God<s%> gives him no <S%H7980>power<s%> to <S%H398>eat<s%> of <S%H376>it,<s%> but an alien <S%H398>eats<s%> <S%H1892>it.<s%> This is vanity, and it is an <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H2483>disease.<s%>

If a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H3205>fathers<s%> a <S%H3967>hundred<s%> <S%H2421>children,<s%> and lives <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H8141>years,<s%> so that the <S%H3117>days<s%> of his <S%H8141>years<s%> are <S%H7227>many,<s%> but his <S%H5315>soul<s%> is not <S%H7646>filled<s%> with <S%H2896>good,<s%> and moreover he has no <S%H6900>burial;<s%> I <S%H559>say,<s%> that a <S%H5309>stillborn<s%> child is better than <S%H2896>he:<s%>
for it <S%H935>comes<s%> in <S%H1892>vanity,<s%> and <S%H3212>departs<s%> in <S%H2822>darkness,<s%> and its <S%H8034>name<s%> is <S%H3680>covered<s%> with <S%H2822>darkness.<s%>
Moreover it has not <S%H7200>seen<s%> the <S%H8121>sun<s%> nor <S%H3045>known<s%> <S%H2088>it.<s%> This has <S%H5183>rest<s%> rather than the <S%H2088>other.<s%>

<S%H432>Yes,<s%> though he <S%H2421>live<s%> a <S%H505>thousand<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%> <S%H6471>twice<s%> <S%H7200>told,<s%> and yet fails to enjoy <S%H2896>good,<s%> <S%H1980>don't<s%> all go to <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H4725>place?<s%>
All the <S%H5999>labor<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%> is for his <S%H6310>mouth,<s%> and yet the <S%H5315>appetite<s%> is not <S%H4390>filled.<s%>

For what advantage has the <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H3148>more<s%> than the <S%H3684>fool?<s%> What has the <S%H6041>poor<s%> <S%H3045>man,<s%> that knows how to <S%H1980>walk<s%> before the <S%H2416>living?<s%>

<S%H2896>Better<s%> is the <S%H4758>sight<s%> of the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> than the <S%H1980>wandering<s%> of the <S%H5315>desire.<s%> This also is <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and a <S%H7469>chasing<s%> after <S%H7307>wind.<s%>

Whatever has <S%H7121>been,<s%> its name was given long <S%H3528>ago;<s%> and it is <S%H3045>known<s%> what <S%H120>man<s%> <S%H3201>is;<s%> neither can he <S%H1777>contend<s%> with him who is mightier than <S%H8623>he.<s%>
For there <S%H3426>are<s%> <S%H7235>many<s%> <S%H1697>words<s%> that <S%H7235>create<s%> <S%H1892>vanity.<s%> What does that <S%H3148>profit<s%> <S%H120>man?<s%>

For who <S%H3045>knows<s%> what is <S%H2896>good<s%> for <S%H120>man<s%> in <S%H2416>life,<s%> <S%H4557>all<s%> the <S%H3117>days<s%> of his <S%H1892>vain<s%> <S%H2416>life<s%> which he <S%H6213>spends<s%> like a <S%H6738>shadow?<s%> For who can <S%H5046>tell<s%> a <S%H120>man<s%> what will be <S%H310>after<s%> him under the <S%H8121>sun?<s%>
